intro: Hieracium argozum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots form a fibrous network. Hieracium argozum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
